name: CreditReport
label: credit report
explanatoryNote: This is typically provided by a credit rating agency but could be produced by an internal proprietary model as well.
definition: report describing the creditworthiness and related credit attributes of a borrower

name: CreditReportProduct
label: credit report product
definition: branded credit report offered in the marketplace

name: CreditRatingAgency
definition: rating agency that publishes reports assessing the creditworthiness of a borrower or legal entity, either generally or with respect to a specific obligation
label: credit rating agency

name: OrganizationCreditRating
label: organization credit rating
definition: credit rating that provides an opinion of creditworthiness of an organization

name: CreditRating
explanatoryNote: Typically, a credit rating is provided as a detailed report based on the financial history of borrowing or lending and creditworthiness of the entity or person derived from income statements, historical records related to borrowing, etc. with an aim to determine their ability to meet debt obligations.
label: credit rating
definition: assessment of creditworthiness of a borrower generally or with respect to a particular debt or financial obligation

name: CreditInquiry
label: credit inquiry
definition: request from a lender to a credit repository to obtain information regarding a prospective borrower's creditworthiness

name: InstrumentCreditRating
definition: investment credit rating that provides an opinion of creditworthiness of an instrument, typically with some relationship to the creditworthiness of the issuer(s)
label: instrument credit rating

name: InvestmentCreditRating
definition: credit rating that provides an opinion of creditworthiness of an investment, including but not limited to an instrument or organization
label: investment credit rating

name: CreditRatingModel
definition: algorithm for computing a credit rating
label: credit rating model

name: CreditMessageType
label: credit message type
definition: classifier that categorizes credit messages

name: CreditQuality
definition: classifier for borrowers, rates, or holdings in the lending market with respect to the quality of the credit
label: credit quality

name: CreditTradeline
explanatoryNote: A tradeline on a credit report refers to a specific credit account. Tradelines report snapshot details derived from a combination of account features and payment history, and are used by credit reporting agencies as inputs to the analysis process that determines a party's credit rating.
definition: report derived from the transaction history of a credit account
label: credit tradeline

name: CreditRatingScale
definition: rating scale for assigning a credit rating to individual, entity, or instrument, including defining a set of codes or numeric scores and indicating how an assessment that is assigned a score based on that scale means
label: credit rating scale

name: CreditRatingModelType
label: credit score model type
definition: a type corresonding to a family of credit scoring algorithms sharing common characteristics

name: CreditMessage
label: credit message
definition: notice on a credit report to alert a reviewer of special or exceptional information

name: CreditReportCategory
definition: classifier for credit reports, often available from multiple vendors
label: credit report category

name: ShortTermCreditRating
label: short term credit rating
definition: credit rating that provides an opinion of the probability of an individual or organization going into default within a year

name: CreditInquiryType
definition: classifier indicating whether a credit inquiry is a result of a borrower's direct authorization or by some indirect means
label: credit inquiry type

name: PrimeQuality
label: prime quality
definition: classifier for borrowers, rates, or holdings that are considered to be of high quality
explanatoryNote: This classification often refers to loans made to high-quality borrowers that are offered prime or relatively low interest rates. Prime loans have low default risk.

name: hasWatchDirection
definition: indicates direction in which an investment credit rating is expected to move in cases where that rating is on watch
label: watch direction

name: AlternativeAQuality
explanatoryNote: Typically Alt-A mortgages are characterized by borrowers with less than full documentation, average credit scores, higher loan-to-values, and more investment properties and secondary homes.
definition: classifier for mortgages that are considered to be riskier than prime quality but less risky than subprime quality
label: alternative-A quality

name: InvestmentGradeQuality
explanatoryNote: Bond rating firms use different designations, often consisting of the upper- and lower-case letters to identify a bond's credit quality rating. 'AAA' and 'AA' (high credit quality) and 'A' and 'BBB' (medium credit quality) are considered investment grade. Credit ratings for bonds below these designations ('BB,' 'B,' 'CCC,' etc.) are considered low credit quality, and are commonly referred to as 'junk bonds.'
definition: classifier for debt instruments that are considered to be of high quality and have a low risk of default
label: investment grade quality

name: NonprimeQuality
label: nonprime quality
definition: classifier for borrowers, rates, or holdings that have poor quality, such as borrowers with poor credit history due to a short sale, bankruptcy, foreclosure and/or other negative credit events within the last several years
explanatoryNote: Nonprime loans may be offered to individuals who are unable to qualify for a conventional loan.

name: concernsParty
label: concerns party
definition: indicates the party for which something is being or has been requested

name: SubprimeQuality
definition: classifier for borrowers, rates, or holdings that are considered below-average quality, such as borrowers with a tarnished or limited credit history, and may be subject to higher than average interest rates
label: subprime quality
explanatoryNote: Subprime refers to borrowers or loans, usually offered at rates well above the prime rate. Subprime lending is higher risk, given the lower credit rating of borrowers.

name: hasWatchOutlook
definition: indicates the expected outlook for the rated entity
label: watch outlook

name: hasCoveragePeriod
label: has coverage period
definition: relates something (e.g. a credit report or insurance policy) to the specific time period that it covers
